data.fullContent: A law office, just like any other business, needs to function smoothly. This is why it's important for them to employ paralegals. The laywers' time and energy are limited and best spent on the aspects of a case that they are uniquely qualified to handle. The job of a paralegal is to handle the lower-level tasks that the lawyers may not have time for: locating documents, performing background research, reviewing materials, filing information, and attending to correspondence. These tasks can be done by a qualified paralegal, freeing the lawyers up to concentrate on the most important aspects of the case at hand.
